reconciliationapi-desc: Enables API modules for entity reconciliation compliant with the Reconciliation Service API (v0.2) as well as autocompletion. The current focus is on making either Semantic MediaWiki or 'MediaWiki core' expose data to the API
reconciliationapi-config-reconapilabelpr: Name of the default SMW Property to use for retrieving the label ('name') of a result and unless 'wgReconAPISearchableLabelProp' is set, to be used for searches to match on. If you use 'Display title of', note that SMW removes HTML tags (italics, subscripts, etc.) automatically
reconciliationapi-config-reconapialtlabe: Not currently implemented but reserved. Name of the default SMW Property to use to retrieve alternative labels by which the subject is known.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapisearcha: Name of the default SMW Property to use for matching on the label of a result. It may be identical to 'wgReconAPILabelProp' but you may want to use a dedicated property that is optimised for searching, e.g. without HTML tags, and that includes alternative labels in the array, making your data easier to find.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapidescrip: Name of the default SMW Property to use for retrieving the short description associated with a result.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapiclasspr: Name of the SMW Property that records the class of a page.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapithumbna: Name of the default SMW Property (Page or Text) to use to retrieve an associated image file as thumbnail.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapibroader: Name of the SMW Property that records a single-level broader class (similar to skos:broader), where this class is represented by a wiki page.
Name of the SMW Property that records a single-level broader Concept (similar to skos:broader).
reconciliationapi-config-reconapismwquer: The base SMW query statement to be used by the 'recon-suggest-type' API module for suggesting categories. Set to null if categories should not be suggested at all.
String. The base SMW query statement to be used by the 'recon-suggest-type' API module to suggest SMW concepts. Set to null if concepts should not be suggested at all.
String. The base SMW query statement to be used by the 'recon-suggest-type' API module to suggest page classes. Set to null if pages should or cannot be suggested at all.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapimaxquer: Integer. The maximum number of queries to be processed by the 'recon' API module. If a hard limit is undesirable, set it to null.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapimaxresu: Integer. The default maximum number of results to show.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapimwusedi: Boolean (MW core only). Whether or not we should attempt to match on display titles and show display titles (not pagenames) as the preferred label in query results. Can be overridden by profile.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapidefault: Array. An optional array of default ''types'' that are considered 'good generic choices for reconciliation'. It provides a default which can be overridden in a profile schema. Class pages and SMW concepts will be ignored if 'source' is set to 'mw'.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapiconsoli: Boolean. Whether in MW core mode, redirect pages should be excluded from search results in favour of showing only their target pages.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapiremovei: Boolean. Whether in SQL searches on native MediaWiki tables, REPLACE should be used to remove italics from values for display titles. Setting it to true improves pattern matching, but may impact performance. If italics are never used in your display titles, it is recommended to set this to false.
reconciliationapi-config-reconredirectde: Default query page to be assumed by Special:ReconRedirect.
reconciliationapi-config-reconapismwclas: Class schema (array) for the Data Extension Property Proposal. The property specified in `propertiesProp` is used to record the properties that may be used with a class. By default, it is assumed that you use the class page to store these annotations. If you cannot or do not want to use a class page, you can also use another wiki page and link to the class through a property specified in `targetClassProp`. See the documentation for a fuller explanation.
apihelp-recon-summary: Service manifest and reconciliation query service for the Reconciliation Service API (https://www.w3.org/community/reports/reconciliation/CG-FINAL-specs-0.2-20230410/). The query service becomes operational when a request is made through queries in the query string; the data extension service when a request is made through extend. Without any of these requests, it returns the manifest.
apihelp-recon-param-profile: Page ID of the configuration profile in the Recon namespace.
apihelp-recon-param-displaytitle: 1 or 0. Whether to match on the display title of the page and use this as the visible label. Defaults to the pagename if no display title was found.
apihelp-recon-param-prefix: (same as 'substr') The substring to autocomplete on.
apihelp-recon-param-substr: (same as 'prefix') The substring to autocomplete on.
apihelp-recon-param-substrpattern: Substring pattern... May be used to override the pattern set in the profile page
apihelp-recon-param-queries: JSON string representing a reconciliation query batch, i.e. 'a set of reconciliation queries indexed by string identifiers' (q0, q1, etc.).
apihelp-recon-param-extend: JSON string representing data extension metadata.
apihelp-recon-suggest-entity-summary: Service for suggesting ''entities'' (https://www.w3.org/community/reports/reconciliation/CG-FINAL-specs-0.2-20230410/#entities), notably wiki pages, with options, e.g. to restrict one's search to a MediaWiki category or namespace.
apihelp-recon-suggest-entity-param-cat: Used only when source=mw, the category or categories (comma-separated, without namespace prefix) to be searched.
apihelp-recon-suggest-entity-param-ns: Used only when source=mw, the namespace or namespaces (comma-separated) to be searched, e.g. Main,Help.
apihelp-recon-suggest-entity-param-displ: Used only when source=mw. Set to 1 to search pages by display title; 0 to search by page title.
apihelp-recon-suggest-entity-param-pfaut: Set this option to 1 (default: 0) if you want to transform results in the format expected by Page Forms' 'values from url' (https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Page_Forms/Values,_mappings_and_autocompletion#Autocompleting_on_outside_values).
apihelp-recon-suggest-property-summary: Service for suggesting ''properties'' whose (page) names match the search condition. In a pure MediaWiki context, ''properties'' typically refer to categories and namespaces in the abstract; in the context of Semantic MediaWiki, to semantic properties as well as concepts, categories and namespaces.
apihelp-recon-suggest-propvalue-summary: Service for suggesting semantic property values (SMW) on the basis of the provided property name and substring. This service is not covered by the Reconciliation API specifications.
apihelp-recon-suggest-propvalue-param-pr: Is not currently configurable through a profile.
The property to retrieve values from.
apihelp-recon-suggest-type-summary: Service for suggesting ''types'' (https://www.w3.org/community/reports/reconciliation/CG-FINAL-specs-0.2-20230410/#types). A ''type'' “represents a category of entities” that must be identifiable with two fields, id (unique) and name, and may be associated with an array of broader types. In the native context of MediaWiki, a ''type'' is understood to translate to a Category. In the context of SMW, it is understood to translate to a wiki page (e.g. Person) used to represent the class of a page, to a Concept, or to a traditional Category.
apihelp-recon-suggest-type-param-cat: Used with source=mw. The top category, or categories, from which to search for lower-level subcategories (max. 250), up to a depth of 5 subcategory levels. Optional.
apihelp-recon-suggest-type-param-typegro: SMW only. A comma-separated list of specific implementations of ''types'', hence 'type groups', that the API is allowed to suggest. Three such 'type groups' are possible: 'class' (i.e. a class page), 'category' (MW Category) and 'concept' (SMW Concept). Default: all three.
apihelp-recon-propose-property-summary: Module part of the Data Extension service. Its purpose is to return ''properties'' for a given ''type'' identifier. In the context of SMW, the ability to propose semantic properties that may be used with a ''type'', such as a class page, requires additional setup on the part of the site admin.
apihelp-recon-propose-property-param-typ: The ''type'' identifier. In MW core, a 'type' can be a category (use the full name with prefix). In the context of SMW, it can be a class page or a category.
apihelp-recon-propose-property-param-lim: Optional limit (integer) to the maximum number of properties that should be returned. 0 means no limit.
